author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: الأَبْهی، أَيْ رَبِّ أَنْتَ الَّذِيْ تَفْعَلُ ما تَشآءُ وَتَحْكُمُ ما تُرِيدُ، كُلُّ ذِيْ قُدْرَةٍ ضَعِيفٌ عِنْدَ ظُهُوراتِ قُوَّتِكَ وَكُلُّ ذِيْ عِزٍّ ذَلِيلٌ لَدَى شُئُوناتِ عِزِّكَ، أَسْئَلُكَ
translation: Thou art He, O my Lord, Who doeth what He willeth, and ordaineth what He pleaseth. Every possessor of power is forlorn before the revelations of Thy might, and every fountain of honor becomes abject when confronted by the manifold evidences of Thy great glory.
